Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.ui

Class CLI

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.client.ui.CLI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    QuestionMessageReceivedListener, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.EventListener
    public class CLI
extends java.lang.Object
implements QuestionMessageReceivedListener, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    This class represents a command line implementation of the user interface of the game

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                       java.io.IOException,
                       java.rmi.NotBoundException
        Initializes the CLI with the needed settings asking the user for his preferences
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a network error occur
        java.rmi.NotBoundException - if the message proxy was not found in the remote RMI registry
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread was forced to stop before construction completion

      • onQuestionMessageReceived

        public void onQuestionMessageReceived​(MessageReceived e)
        Manages questions
        Specified by:
        onQuestionMessageReceived in interface QuestionMessageReceivedListener
        Parameters:
        e - the MessageReceived event

      • manageQuestion

        private void manageQuestion​(Message message)
        Given a question message it shows it to the user and ask for a selection. Once a valid selection has been made by the user, the answer is forwarded through the connector
        Parameters:
        message - a question message

      • askForSelection

        private int askForSelection​(java.lang.String questionText,
                            java.lang.Object[] options,
                            boolean skippable)
        Method used for interacting with the user. It asks a question and wait for a valid user selection between the available options
        Parameters:
        questionText - the text of the question
        options - the available options to choose from
        skippable - indicates whether or not the answer can be none of the available options
        Returns:
        0 if the user didn't choose any of the presented options 1..options.length, corresponding to the option index in the array + 1

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes this object and the associated connector
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs during the closing operation
